intro: Hypochaeris subalpina, commonly known as the alpine hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Hypochaeris subalpina is often found in alpine and subalpine zones, where it adapts to cold and harsh environmental conditions.
